thread.title: UEFA charges England and Lithuania for crowd disturbances
thread.title_full: UEFA charges England and Lithuania for crowd disturbances

author: wtopstaff
title: UEFA charges England and Lithuania for crowd disturbances
text:
Home » News » Sports » UEFA charges England and… UEFA charges England and Lithuania for crowd disturbances By The Associated Press October 14, 2015 5:08 am Lithuania's Georgas Freidgeimas, right, and England's Alex Oxlade Chamberlain challenge for the ball during the Euro 2016 group E qualifying soccer match between the Lithuania and England at the LFF stadium in Vilnius, Lithuania, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015. (AP Photo/Mindaugas Kulbis) 
NYON, Switzerland (AP) — UEFA has opened disciplinary cases against England and Lithuania over crowd disturbances in their final European Championship qualifier. 
The Lithuanian federation has also been charged for breaching ticketing regulations by blocking stairways. 
UEFA’s disciplinary body will hear the case next Thursday. 
England won Monday’s match in Vilnius 3-0. Topics:
